description: Founding member of “The Supremes”, Mary Wilson, Attorney Maya Wiley and former Executive Editor of “The New York Times”, Howell Raines, join Ari Melber for Fallback Friday on “The Beat”. Wilson calls out millennials for their poor manners, Wiley blasts Democr…
fulltext:
The Supremes’ Mary Wilson tells Millennials to fall back! copied!

Founding member of “The Supremes”, Mary Wilson, Attorney Maya Wiley and former Executive Editor of “The New York Times”, Howell Raines, join Ari Melber for Fallback Friday on “The Beat”. Wilson calls out millennials for their poor manners, Wiley blasts Democrat Tim Ryan for claiming another “competent female” could replace Nancy Pelosi and Ari says the Florida elections and Brenda Snipes need to fall back for missing the recount deadline. Howell Raines hopes Jeff Sessions doesn’t eye his old Alabama Senate seat.

author: MSNBC.com
title: Bombshell: Legal pressure on central Mueller probe figure Assange
description: A slip up from a prosecutor reveals prosecutors are preparing criminal charges against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange. It is unclear whether the charges relate to Wikileaks’ 2010 publishing of secret diplomatic cables, its leak of material from Russian hack…
fulltext:
Bombshell: Legal pressure on central Mueller probe figure Assange copied!

A slip up from a prosecutor reveals prosecutors are preparing criminal charges against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange. It is unclear whether the charges relate to Wikileaks’ 2010 publishing of secret diplomatic cables, its leak of material from Russian hackers in 2016 , to their' publishing of material, or conspiring with a foreign country to steal material. Former Prosecutor John Flannery and Daily Beast’s Betsy Woodruff join Ari Melber to discuss.

Read More

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sam Nunberg spills on Mueller probe Grand Jury questions
description: President Trump confirms he is taking Special Counsel Mueller’s questions on collusion and providing written answers. Trump stressed that he himself was answering the questions, not his lawyers. Watergate Prosecutor Nick Akerman tells Ari Melber “no decent la…
fulltext:
Sam Nunberg spills on Mueller probe Grand Jury questions copied!

President Trump confirms he is taking Special Counsel Mueller’s questions on collusion and providing written answers. Trump stressed that he himself was answering the questions, not his lawyers. Watergate Prosecutor Nick Akerman tells Ari Melber “no decent lawyer” would let Trump answer those questions himself and former Trump campaign adviser, Sam Nunberg, reveals what questions he was asked concerning Roger Stone and Paul Manafort during his Grand Jury testimony. Nunberg also credits Maya Wiley for her advice to him on "The Beat" which helped convince him to comply with the Grand Jury subpoena.
